['GSM4150377_sciPlex2_A549_Transcription_Modulators_UMI.count.matrix',
 'GSM4150377_sciPlex2_hashSampleSheet.txt',
 'GSM4150377_sciPlex2_A549_Transcription_Modulators_hashTable.out.txt',

ll = list( filter(lambda x: 'gene.annotations' in x, l ) )
print(ll)
genes = pd.read_csv(dirname + ll[0], sep = '\t', header = None)

display(genes)
ll = list( filter(lambda x: 'cell.annotations' in x, l ) )
print(ll)
cells = pd.read_csv(dirname + ll[0], sep = '\t', header = None)
display(cells)

print(ll)

display(info_dict_cells2drugs)
s = set(cells[0]) & set( info_dict_cells2drugs[1] ) 
print( len(s), len(cells) )

ll = list( filter(lambda x: 'hashSampleSheet' in x, l ) )
print(ll)

display(hashSampleSheet)

ll = list( filter(lambda x: 'pData' in x, l ) )

pData = pd.read_csv(dirname + ll[0],sep = ' ')# , header = None)

print()
t0 = time.time()
ll = list( filter(lambda x: 'count.matrix' in x, l ) )
expression_matrix_in_sparse_form = pd.read_csv( dirname + ll[0], sep = '\t', header = None)
print(np.round(time.time() - t0,2),'seconds passed' )
print('Each row in file has format - (i,j, value) - that means that count_matrix[i,j]=value')
expression_matrix_in_sparse_form[0] -= 1
expression_matrix_in_sparse_form[1] -= 1
display(expression_matrix_in_sparse_form)

from scipy.sparse import csr_matrix
m = csr_matrix((expression_matrix_in_sparse_form[2].values, (expression_matrix_in_sparse_form[0].values, 
                     expression_matrix_in_sparse_form[1].values))) # , shape=(len(genes), len(cells) ))#.toarray()

print(m.shape)
source.4490259e:
df = pd.DataFrame(index = pData.index, data = range(len(pData) ), columns = ['i'] )
df['n.umi'] = pData['n.umi']
df['Size_Factor'] = pData['Size_Factor']

f = lambda x: x if not isinstance(x, str)  else x.split('_')[0]
df['drug'] = pData['top_oligo'].apply(f )
f = lambda x: x if not isinstance(x, str)  else float(x.split('_')[1])
df['dose'] = pData['top_oligo'].apply(f )
print(np.sort( df['dose'].unique()), df['dose'].isnull().sum() )
print(( df['dose'].value_counts()) )


m2 = m != 0
df['count genes expressed'] = np.array( m2.sum(axis = 1) ).ravel()

l = np.array( [ x.startswith('MT-')  for x in genes[1]], dtype = bool )
mask_MT_genes = l
print('Count mitochondrial genes:', l.sum(), ' out of: ', len(genes) )
mt_expression_sum = np.array(m[:,mask_MT_genes].sum(axis=1)).ravel()
non_mt_expression_sum = np.array( m[:,~mask_MT_genes].sum(axis=1)).ravel()
ratio_mt2non_mt = (1+mt_expression_sum)/(1+non_mt_expression_sum)
df['ratio mt2non_mt'] = ratio_mt2non_mt


df

source.c4d7dff0:
if 1:
    m2 = m.copy()
    m2.data = np.log(1+m2.data)
    m2 = m2.multiply( 1/m2.sum(axis=1))
    m2 = m2.tocsr()
    str_preproc = 'LogThenNorm'
else:
    m2 = m.multiply( 1/m.sum(axis=1))
    m2 = m2.tocsr()
    m2.data = np.log(1+m2.data)
    str_preproc = 'NormThenLog'

print(str_preproc)#  
print(m2[:4,:4].toarray())
print(m2.sum(axis = 1)[:4])

source.c3f75fcb:
import seaborn  as sns
from sklearn.decomposition import TruncatedSVD
import time
import umap

reducer = umap.UMAP(random_state=42)
str_reducer = 'UMAP'
#reducer = ncvis.NCVis()
#reducer =  trimap.TRIMAP()
svd = TruncatedSVD( n_components=50, n_iter=7, random_state=42)


v = np.asarray(m2.sum(axis=0)).ravel()
IX = np.argsort(v )

t00 = time.time()
for count_made_zeros in [10]: # range(10,100,10):

    m3 = m2.copy()#  != 0 # 
    if count_made_zeros != 0:
        #m3[:,IX[-count_made_zeros:]] = 0
        m3 = m3[:,IX[:-count_made_zeros]] # droping columns - same as make them zeros , but does not create memory alloc prob


    t0 = time.time()
    r = svd.fit_transform(m3)
    print(time.time() - t0, 'seconds passed on svd')
    t0 = time.time()
    r = reducer.fit_transform(r)
    print(time.time() - t0, 'seconds passed on ', str_reducer)
    
    fig = plt.figure(figsize = (20,12))
    c = 0; 

    c+=1; fig.add_subplot(1, 2 , c)         
    color_by = df['drug'].copy()
    sns.scatterplot(x=r[:,0],y=r[:,1],   hue= color_by, alpha = 0.7, marker = '.')
    plt.title(str_reducer + '.  Color by drug. count_made_zeros='  +str( count_made_zeros ) + ' Non binarized' )

    c+=1; fig.add_subplot(1, 2 , c)         
    color_by = df['dose'].copy()
    color_by[color_by == 'NAN'] = -1
    color_by = color_by.astype(float)
    color_by = np.log10(2+color_by)
    sns.scatterplot(x=r[:,0],y=r[:,1],   hue= color_by, alpha = 0.7, marker = '.')
    plt.title(str_reducer + ' Color by log10 of dose. count_made_zeros='  +str( count_made_zeros )+ ' Non binarized' )
    plt.show()
    
    print(time.time() - t0, 'seconds passed')

print('Finished.', time.time() - t00, 'seconds passed total ')

# Show that expression and variance are both growing 

t = m2.copy()
t.data **= 2#.toarray()
#print( t.toarray() )
X_var = np.array(t.mean(axis = 0 )).ravel() - np.array(m2.mean(axis = 0) ).ravel()**2  

genes['Variance'] = X_var
plt.plot( np.sort( (  genes['Variance'].values) ))

genes['Expression Sum'] = np.asarray(m2.sum(axis = 0)).ravel()

g2 = genes.sort_values('Expression Sum')
g2 = genes.sort_values('Variance')

plt.plot(np.log10(1+ g2['Expression Sum'].values) )
# plt.plot(g2['Variance'].values)
plt.show()
plt.plot(np.log10(1+ g2['Variance'].values) )
plt.show()

import seaborn  as sns
from sklearn.decomposition import TruncatedSVD
import time
import umap

reducer = umap.UMAP(random_state=42)
str_reducer = 'UMAP'
#reducer = ncvis.NCVis()
#reducer =  trimap.TRIMAP()
svd = TruncatedSVD( n_components=50, n_iter=7, random_state=42)


v = np.asarray(m2.sum(axis=0)).ravel()
IX = np.argsort(v )

t00 = time.time()

count_made_zeros_top = 10
for count_made_zeros_tail in [5000,9000, 9500,9900,9930]: # range(10,100,10):

    m3 = m2.copy()#  != 0 # 
    if count_made_zeros_top != 0:
        #m3[:,IX[-count_made_zeros:]] = 0
        m3 = m3[:,IX[count_made_zeros_tail:-count_made_zeros_top]] # droping columns - same as make them zeros , but does not create memory alloc prob


    t0 = time.time()
    r = svd.fit_transform(m3)
    print(time.time() - t0, 'seconds passed on svd')
    t0 = time.time()
    r = reducer.fit_transform(r)
    print(time.time() - t0, 'seconds passed on ', str_reducer)
    
    fig = plt.figure(figsize = (20,12))
    c = 0; 

    c+=1; fig.add_subplot(1, 2 , c)         
    color_by = df['drug'].copy()
    sns.scatterplot(x=r[:,0],y=r[:,1],   hue= color_by, alpha = 0.7, marker = '.')
    plt.title(str_reducer + '.  Color by drug. count_made_zeros='  +str( count_made_zeros_tail ) +' ' +str( count_made_zeros_top )  )

    c+=1; fig.add_subplot(1, 2 , c)         
    color_by = df['dose'].copy()
    color_by[color_by == 'NAN'] = -1
    color_by = color_by.astype(float)
    color_by = np.log10(2+color_by)
    sns.scatterplot(x=r[:,0],y=r[:,1],   hue= color_by, alpha = 0.7, marker = '.')
    plt.title(str_reducer + '.  Color by drug. count_made_zeros='  +str( count_made_zeros_tail ) +' ' +str( count_made_zeros_top )  )
    plt.show()
    
    print(time.time() - t0, 'seconds passed')

print('Finished.', time.time() - t00, 'seconds passed total ')

source.d2917c3e:
# What is about 

Here we analyse sciPlex2 subdataset. We consider filering out genes and cells and checking that result of umap image does not change significantly. So such filterings are Okay. 

First filter out douplets cells which are seen by umap - about 3200 cells.

Second filter out genes expressed in less than 3 cells - get 35600+ from 58437 

No need to filter out cells further since - all cells have more than 200 genes expressed. 

Third we look on how many top variable / top expressed genes we can leave.
At the begeninng we check that both conditions are more or less the same,
then we check that leaving 10 000, 5 000, 1 000, 500 genes does not change umap image significantly. 
That means we can expect  that keeping those  number of genes is relatively safe. 
Only leaving 100 genes leads to visible change. 


Fourth we check intersection of top genes with cell cycle phase markers: top 1000 genes intersects very little - 1,2 markers.
So from that perspective it is better to keep more genes. 

Precise numbers: 

Keep 10 000 genes  - get  31, 48 out of 43,54 cell cycle phase markers for phases (S and G2M respectively)  
 
For 8 000 - 31, 48

For 5 000 - 11, 24


------------------

#### Dataset reminder:

It is the second "toy" subdataset, while sciPlex3 is the main very huge subdataset.

Here - only one cell line - A549 - human lung adenocarcinoma.

Exposed to 4 different compounds DEXA, nutlin, BMS, SAHA (HDAC).

24 hours across SEVEN doses. 

24262 cells x 58347 genes


'GSM4150377_sciPlex2_pData.txt' - contains information on: cell+drugs+doses+etc... There are 24262 rows - one row - one cell.
The index (=row number) of cell in that file corresponds to its index in the countmatrix (after transforming csv file with count matrix to sparse countmatrix)

Count matrix (in list of edges format), cell ids, genes ids are in the files (respectively):
'GSM4150377_sciPlex2_A549_Transcription_Modulators_UMI.count.matrix',
 'GSM4150377_sciPlex2_A549_Transcription_Modulators_cell.annotations.txt',
 'GSM4150377_sciPlex2_A549_Transcription_Modulators_gene.annotations.txt',

For 10 000 - 31, 48 out of 43,54
